required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preventing Excessive Gestational Weight Gain in Obese Women
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Excessive Gestational Weight Gain in Obese Women

lead_sponsor.agency: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

clinical_study.source: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study the effects of a multicomponent lifestyle intervention that includes partial meal replacements as a means to prevent excessive gestational weight gain in obese women. The primary hypothesis is that the intervention will reduce the rate of gestational weight gain compared with standard care.

primary_outcome.measure: Weight gain per week of observation
primary_outcome.description: Rate of gestational weight gain will be computed as difference between weights measured at study entry and gestational week 35; this difference will be divided by the number of weeks of observation during pregnancy (i.e., weeks between study entry and final pregnancy assessment). If gestational week 35 is unavailable, most proximal clinic visit weight will be used.

secondary_outcome.description: Offspring weight for age z scores from birth (1 week), to 6 months, and 12 months of age.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 13 weeks gestation, 34 weeks gestatation, 6 months postpartum, 12 months postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in maternal calorie intake (Kcal/day) and fat intake (% kcal from fat).
Changes in offspring intake of breast milk (#feeds per day) and/or formula (#feeds per day).

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in maternal glucose, insulin, and lipids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 13 weeks gestation, 34 weeks gestation, 6 months postpartum. 12 months postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women exceeding IOM guidelines
secondary_outcome.description: Women will be categorized as exceeding or not exceeding IOM guidelines for gestational weight gain. Self-reported pre-pregnancy weight will be subtracted from weight measured at last clinic visit prior to delivery. Women will be categorized as exceeding or not exceeding 2009 IOM guidelines.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women at or below prepregnancy weight
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 22-30 weeks post delivery, 48-56 weeks post delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Weight measured at 22-30 and 48-56 weeks postpartum and subtracted from self-reported prepregnancy weight and then categorized as at or below vs. above self-reported prepregnancy weight.

intervention.description: The intervention is a multicomponent program designed to prevent excessive gestational weight gain in obese women through modifications of diet, exercise, and behavioral strategies during pregnancy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Over 18 years old
- < 16 weeks gestation
- BMI >= 25
- Willing to consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant with Twins
- Untreated medical or psychological problem
- Inability to be physically active

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo
